prompt: Hulk Hogan, born Terry Gene Bollea, is a renowned retired American professional wrestler. Please write a short biography of Hulk Hogan.
response:
Hulk Hogan, born Terry Gene Bollea, is a retired American professional wrestler and entrepreneur, best known for his iconic mustache and bandana. Born on March 12, 1952, in Augusta, Georgia, Hogan grew up in a small town in Florida, where he developed a passion for bodybuilding and weightlifting.

After dropping out of high school, Hogan began competing in local bodybuilding competitions, eventually earning the title of Mr. Tampa Bay in 1976. He went on to train under legendary wrestler Hiro Matsuda and made his professional wrestling debut in 1977.

Hogan's charismatic personality and impressive physique quickly made him a fan favorite, earning him a spot in the World Wide Wrestling Federation (WWWF), now known as WWE. He won his first WWF Championship in 1984, defeating "Rowdy" Roddy Piper, and went on to hold the title a record-breaking eight times.

During his wrestling career, Hogan was part of some of the most memorable rivalries in WWE history, including his epic battles with "Macho Man" Randy Savage, Andre the Giant, and "The Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase. He also made history as the first wrestler to win the WWF Championship at WrestleMania, the company's flagship event.

In addition to his wrestling career, Hogan has made appearances in several films and television shows, including "Rocky III," "Suburban Commando," and "Hogan Knows Best," a reality TV series that aired on VH1 from 2005 to 2007.

After retiring from wrestling in 2008, Hogan remained a beloved figure in the world of professional wrestling, making sporadic appearances and participating in various charity events. Despite facing personal struggles, including a high-profile divorce and a series of lawsuits, Hogan remains an iconic figure in the world of sports entertainment.

Terry Gene Bollea, better known by his ring name Hulk Hogan, is a legendary American professional wrestler, actor, and television personality. Born on August 11, 1953, in Augusta, Georgia, Hogan rose to fame in the 1980s as a charismatic and muscular wrestler with a distinctive mustache and bandana.

Hogan began his wrestling career in the 1970s, competing in various regional promotions and eventually joining the World Wrestling Federation (WWF), now known as WWE, in 1983. He quickly gained popularity due to his "Hulkamania" persona, which emphasized his all-American image, mustache, and feisty wrestling style.

Throughout the 1980s, Hogan became a household name, holding multiple championships and headlining numerous WrestleManias, the WWF's flagship event. He formed a legendary tag-team with "Macho Man" Randy Savage and feuded with the likes of Andre the Giant, "Ravishing" Rick Rude, and "Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase.

In the 1990s, Hogan transitioned to the World Championship Wrestling (WCW) organization, where he continued to wrestle and hold championships. He made his acting debut in the 1980s, appearing in films such as "Rocky III" and "Suburban Commando."

Hogan was inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame in 2005 and was named the number one wrestling star of all time by the WWE in 2009. He has continued to make sporadic appearances for various wrestling promotions and has been involved in various business ventures, including a reality TV show and a line of energy drinks.

Despite facing personal controversies and scandals throughout his career, Hulk Hogan remains one of the most recognizable and beloved figures in professional wrestling history.
